<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">No generation had more anxiety to preserve</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the substance from decay. The tombs</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>tombs</del> They <del>seem to pretend</del> Their</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">graves are immaculately. <del>One</del> They defy death</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with their great tombs. In life they</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">eat prodigously. They wear clothes that are</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so heavy they can scarcely stand in them.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The outer life is as [illeg.]: as</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>great</del> cloth of gold & marble can make it.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>But the passions <del>that</del> <del>hunt in the</del> heart</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del><del>are</del> within are <del>silent</del> Until the dramatists</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">speak <add place="above">for</add> them on the stage, they themselves are silent.</l>
